requirement.topic: XmlBlaster sends the state of a message in the qos argument of an update
requirement.description: When a client receives an update message, the state is usually set to OK. If the message is expired, the state is set to 'EXPIRED'. You may retrieve the message state in the qos argument of the update: <state>.
requirement.example:
<qos>
         <state>  <!-- Server state -->
            EXPIRED  <!-- OK | EXPIRED | ERASED -->
         </state>
      </qos>
requirement.author: ruff@swand.lake.de
